attributes.action: British public to vote for/against boycott against Islamic countries
attributes.additional_details:
The boycott would assist in resolving religious conflict and tension within the UK; see:
• 20% of British Muslims sympathise with terrorism (ICM Research)
• 37% of 16 to 24-year-olds would rather live under sharia law (ICM Research)
• 80% of London's Muslims support the Islamic State (Al Jazeera)
• 20% of Syrians want life under ISIS (ORB International)
• The Muslim population in the UK in 2011 was 2.7 million, set to rise to 26 m in 2051, meaning the country will become an Islamic state
attributes.background:
The British public have never been given a chance to vote for or against immigration decisions.

The boycott:
i) all immigration from Muslim countries would stop
ii) all Muslim citizens involved in terrorist activities would be deported
iii) all trade with Islamic states would stop
